column4: HELP Me I installed libstdc++6_4.0.2-10_i386.deb by dpkg -i. Now i can't delete it apt-get -r don't help me apt-get -f don't help me dpkg -r don't help me.
You need to uninstall it manually.
bad idea in the first place, sorry to say... :\
Easiest is probably to manually remove the older version, but it might break your system...
Please don't spam... people will help you at some time.
What happens on "sudo apt-get -f install libstdc++"? I hope you already took the 3rd party repository out of apt.
It's said that libstdc ( but I wrote libstdc++) can't be find
Take the 3rd party repo out of /etc/apt/sources.list. Then, what does "dpkg -l | grep libstdc++" say?
Just a minute I translate it
